release.action: Double-clicking an entry in a table opens the editor for it.
Added a menu with the same actions as the toolbar.
Actions like deleting a food entry can now be executed by keyboard shortcuts.
Show splash screen on startup.
Toolbar only shows icons.
Changed default Look and Feel.
Food items can now be added either to a list of convenience foods or miscellaneous food.
Added icons to the user interface.
Tables are resized if the window gets resized.
The default window size has been changed to be more ergonomical.
German translations.
Support for multiple languages.
Only ask the user if he wants to save the data before exiting if there have been any changes.
Data is loaded automatically on application startup.
Added support for handling different file format versions. Future Housekeeper releases will now be able to open data generated with older application versions.
Ask user if he wants to save modifications before exiting the application.
Fixed display problems when running under JRE 5.0.
Items with no expiry date are now displayed after any item which has a specified expiry date in the default table sorting.
Closing a dialog does now behave like pressing the Cancel button.
Fixed a problem where actions on food items sometimes modified the wrong item.
Food items are not forced to have an expiry date anymore.
Fixed application execution in Windows.
Modified start script for Unix derivaties to enable application start from a file manager.
Added logging component for display of messages in the console.
Implemented robust persistence layer using JDOM for reading and writing XML.
Added basic item management functionality. (Add, Delete, Modify, Duplicate)
Items can be sorted by clicking on the table header.
Simple saving and loading mechanism implemented. BUT: Files saved with this version will not be readable in the future anymore!
Basic about dialog with information about the libraries which are used.
